HEADER.TITLE: Disyllabic nouns placed in a carrier sentence, in order to bring out their tone patterns. Speaker F4, year 2007.

NOTE.message: The document essentially contains disyllabic nouns. Only one example of four of the tone categories of monosyllables are provided, at the beginning of the document: H, M, LH and M. Also, some verbs were accidentally included, because they were interpreted as nouns. These tokens are grouped at the end of the document.
Disyllabic nouns are grouped by tone: M, #H, MH#, H$, L, L#, LM+MH#, LM+#H, LM, LH, and H#.

This document was produced by putting together 8 files recorded on the same fieldtrip. The boundaries between documents fall at: (i) 6:58,84 (ii) 9:13,04 (iii) 15:28,94 (iv) 21:52,14 (v) 22:05,84 (vi) 24:19,40 and (vii) 26:10,32.
The original is a MONO audio file.

W.FORM: ʈʂʰɯ˧ | tsʰo˧pjɤ˧ ɲi˩. | ʈʂʰɯ˧ | tsʰo˧pjɤ˧ ɲi˩. |

NOTE.message: The demonstrative /ʈʂʰɯ/ is here realized as [ʈʂʰv], through anticipation of the following rhyme. This is not a phonological process of vowel harmony, but a slip of the tongue. Note, however, that regressive vowel harmony is a salient phonetic tendency in Yongning Na.

W.FORM: ʈʂʰv̩˧dʑɯ˧ ɲi˩. | ʈʂʰv̩˧dʑɯ˧ ɲi˩. | ʈʂʰɯ˧ | ʈʂʰv̩˧dʑɯ˧ ɲi˩. | ʈʂʰv̩˧dʑɯ˧ ɲi˩. |

NOTE.message: Hyperarticulated token, separating successive syllables. The final portion, /pi˧-ɲi˥-mæ˩/, is intonationally weaker, hence its initial perception as /‡pi˧-ɲi˩-mæ˩/.
This token brings out the pronunciation of the copula: with L tone.

W.TRANSL: fichu (tissu qu'on porte sur la tête)

W.FORM: ʈʂʰɯ˧ | qʰwæ˧ʈɯ˥ ɲi˩. | ʈʂʰɯ˧ | qʰwæ˧ʈɯ˥ ɲi˩. |
W.TRANSL: fichu (tissu qu'on porte sur la tête)
young chap, young lad, young man
ceinture (large, tissée à la main; terme technique: "gaine")
腰带，用来背小孩的带子

W.FORM: ɬi˧pæ˥ ɲi˩. | ɬi˧pæ˥ ɲi˩. | "ɬi˧pæ˥ ɲi˩" | pi˧-mv̩˩!

W.TRANSL: 是哪个？/是哪一种？（发音人的汉语翻译：“啥子一样是？”）
Which one is it? / Which sort is it?
Il y a eu un éclair!
There has been a flash of lightning!
On dit: "Il y a eu un éclair"!
One says: "There has been a flash of lightning!"

NOTE.message: This token sounds like /ʈʂʰɯ˧ | njæ˩qwæ˧-hĩ˥. | ʈʂʰɯ˧ | njæ˩qwæ˧-hĩ˥ ɲi˩/; but there is no /hĩ/ syllable present, according to the speaker.
Hyperarticulated realization, close to [‡ʈʂʰɯ˧ | njæ˩qwæ˧˥-ɲi˥], i.e. with a double realization of the H part of the MH tone contour of /njæ˩qwæ˧˥/: on the word proper, and on the following copula.
Hyperarticulated realization, close to [‡ʈʂʰɯ˧ | njæ˩qwæ˧˥-ɲi˥], i.e. with a double realization of the H part of the MH tone contour of /njæ˩qwæ˧˥/: on the word proper, and on the following copula.

W.FORM: ʈʂʰɯ˧ | tsi˧ hɯ˧-ɲi˥! | ʈʂʰɯ˧ | tsi˧ hɯ˧-ɲi˥!

W.TRANSL: One should say: "A crack/fissure has appeared!"

W.FORM: ʈʂʰɯ˧ | tsi˧ hɯ˧-ɲi˥! | ʈʂʰɯ˧ | tsi˧ hɯ˧-ɲi˥!

NOTE.message: verb: /tsi˧ hɯ˧/ 'to have a fissure', from /tsi˥/ 'fissure'

W.FORM: ʈʂʰɯ˧ | njo˩ ki˥… -ɲi˩. | ʈʂʰɯ˧ | njo˩ ki˥-ɲi˩. |
